activities.loc: Parties to appear remotely via Zoom.

result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.
result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Mariah A Hodges

records.addlTxt: To Seal Victim/Witness Identification Key signed by Judge Michael O. Bohren on 10/28/22

Defendant to comply with I.D. Processing. Defendant to have no contact with Kohl's Department Store/witness A/co-actor listed in the Criminal Complaint/Victim Identification Key.  Defendant is not to share, reproduce or distribute any personal and/or identifying information about the crime victim(s), except to their attorney. Absolute sobriety, defendant is not to possess or consume any alcohol. Defendant is not to use/possess any controlled substances without a valid prescription and take as prescribed. Defendant not to possess any drug paraphernalia.

1:50 PM District Attorney's Office Law Intern appeared for the State of Wisconsin by Julian Marrufo. Defendant Mariah A Hodges in court, in custody.  Attorney Steven Hughes in court for Mariah A Hodges. 

Defense acknowledges receipt of complaint and waives reading of complaint. 
Service admitted/advised of charges and potential penalties. 
Court advises of right to an attorney. Defendant is eligible for State Public Defender representation.  An attorney will be appointed. 
Preliminary Hearing requested. Preliminary time limits waived.
Preliminary hearing scheduled for November 23, 2022 at 09:15 am.
Status conference scheduled for November 22, 2022 at 01:00 pm.
Status conference on November 22, 2022 at 01:00 pm.
Preliminary hearing on November 23, 2022 at 09:15 am.
